abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Heat Reform and Building
            Energy Efficiency Project for China were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to global
            environment outcome was moderate, Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            strong project management units are needed especially for
            projects with transformative objectives depending mainly on
            outcomes from technical assistance. Concentration of
            resources can help to enhance engagement needed to catalyze
            change, reduce transaction costs, and increase local
            government support. Engaging real estate developers to
            promote more advanced building energy efficiency concepts
            requires more incentives than partial grant support.
            District heating sector reform in transition economies
            requires a long term engagement that can be accelerated with
            strengthened institutions and regulations.
